ETYMOLOGY: From Portuguese 'manga', which came from Malay 'mangga', which in turn came from Tamil 'māṅkāy' ('man' meaning 'mango tree' + 'kay' meaning 'fruit').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A fleshy, oval, sweet tropical fruit with a large, flat pit, typically yellow-red when ripe.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种椭圆形、肉质、香甜的热带水果，内含一个扁平的大核，成熟时通常呈黄红色。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She cut the ripe mango into slices for breakfast.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她把熟透的芒果切成片作早餐。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The tropical tree (Mangifera indica) that produces the mango fruit.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种热带树木（学名：Mangifera indica），结出芒果果实。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The garden has a large mango tree that yields abundant fruit every summer.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 花园里有一棵很大的芒果树，每年夏天都结出丰硕的果实。
